item.description:
Did you know that during a one-inch rainstorm, over 500 gallons of water will fall on your roof? Rain gardens are ecologically-friendly landscaped areas designed to soak up water from driveways, rooftops, and other hard surfaces. Discussion will touch on other methods to reduce stormwater runoff, including rain barrels and native plants. Discover how easy it is to incorporate one into your landscape, and reduce your impact on the environment!

This topic will be presented by Mary Gilbertson of our own meetup group!

Potluck Supper starting at 6:30 p.m. followed by presentation/questions/discussion

Last name starting with A-G bring whatever you want
Last name starting with H-M bring bread or beverage
Last name starting with N-S main or side dish to share
Last name starting with T-Z bring salad or veg or dessert

Don't forget to bring your own potluck kit of plate/bowl/cup/utensils/cloth napkin - we're trying to move away from disposable or even compostable stuff!

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: February Meetup: Rain Gardens w/Mary Gilbertson
